page.title: 04Population Movement/Blaby.
page.content: Work undertaken by class J1/2H (7/8 yrs)at Blaby Stokes Primary School.{ { Results:}(424 people questioned) { A-}72% had always lived within a 10 mile radius of Blaby. { B-}27% moved to Blaby from locations throughout Great Britain(no particular pattern apparent). { C-}1% moved to Blaby from foreign countries, (ie. people of African or Indian origin). Marriage and work have proved to be the two main causes of bringing people into the area.Blaby has developed greatly as a residential and commercial centre since the Great War.A large number of people are still of local origin.As yet,there is little impact from Commonwealth Immigration and the area still retains its mono-cultural character with little multi-ethnic influence.
